Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Public class Game represents everything that this game should have, including board (on which we move our pieces ), multiple pirates ( represent environment to play against) and player.
    Since:
    18/1/2019
    Version:
    1.0.0 (alfa)
    Author:
    Mirnel Bucan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Represents a board on which we play

      Represents state of game if it ended (player lost) or not
      private int level
      Current level of game
      private int numOfIslands
      Number of islands on each level
      private int numOfPirates
      Number of pirates on each level
      (package private) Pirate[] pirates
      Represents multiple enemies on board
      (package private) Ship ship
      Represents player

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()

    • Method Detail

      • getLevel

        int getLevel()
        Getter for level
        Returns:
        int Current level of the game

      • setGameOver

        void setGameOver(boolean gameOver)
        Setter for gameOver
        Parameters:
        gameOver - Represents current state of game

      • init

        public void init()
        Function init() is used to initialize board and pieces on it. It randomly puts pirates and islands , while player is fixed with his starting position pirates and islands must be atleast 5 places away from player.

      • moveShip

        public void moveShip()
        This function is used to move player on the board. It prevents player from moving out of array bounds. it also checks for player collision with env.

      • movePirates

        public void movePirates()
        This function is used to move pirate on board. It also detects collision with env, and separates collision with player and other obstacles to be able to detects end of game if pirate manages to destroys player.

      • AI

        private void AI()
        This function is used for making pirates movements. Represents basic AI, works on distance between player and pirate, than decides which direction to move.

      • checkMove

        boolean checkMove(int row,
                  int col,
                  int dir)
        This function is used to prevent player from moving out of bounds of map
        Parameters:
        row - Represents in which row player is currently on
        col - Represents in which column player is currently on
        dir - Represents in which direction player is attempting to move
        Returns:
        True if players move is allowed, false if not.

      • end

        boolean end()

      • nextLevel

        boolean nextLevel()
        This function determines if player managed to get to portal
        Returns:
        Returns true if player gets to portal, false otherwise.

      • restart

        void restart()
        This function is used to return initial game state.

      • moveToNextLevel

        void moveToNextLevel()
        This function is used to simulate next level of difficulty by increasing number of obstacles
